oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Newspaper, Forney's War Press
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Original newspaper, Forney's War Press, Saturday, October 24, 1863. The illustration shows a Confederate ram under construction in England. The Confederates contracted with several British firms for ship construction during the war. The most famous ship; built in England was the CSS Alabama. The construction of these ships lead to tension between the US and Great Britian after the war. Ultimately, the British paid the US $15.5 million to settle the issue. Forney's newspaper covered war news.
